question: Who had became a member of the Brahmo Samaj in 1856 and founded his own breakaway “Brahmo Samaj of India” in 1866?
explanation: Keshub Chandra Sen was a social reformer from the Bengal Presidency of British India. In the year 1856, he joined the Brahmo Samaj. Later he founded Bharatvarshiya Brahmo Samaj in 1866. He was inspired by Christianity, and Vaishnav bhakti, and Hindu practices. In the year 1860, he established the Sangat Sabha.
